Reviews.Title: Great attractive laptop!
Reviews.Author: Deb from MA
Reviews.Content: Sony VAIO E15 Series SVE15124CXP 15.5-Inch Laptop (Pink)Really love this laptop-windows 8 was easy to learn, startup was fast, easy to personalize, does well for online games which i am a fan of, super storage space, pink color is very nice, not too loud. Can set keyboard to only light when touched, which helps with the battery life, love it!!

Reviews.Title: I am in love!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "betlou"
Reviews.Content: I have had dozens of pc's over the years dating back to the 80's with 286 IBM 6mhz. The brands included Gateway, Emachine, Pbell, Asus, Dell, Toshiba etc. and a beloved Sony Vaio.In my opinion, I have always thought Sony screens were superior to other brands (with the exception of Apple of course) the screen quality has always been very important to me, and again Sony excels. The screen is simply, stunning.I was concerned with ordering online, a pink laptop. I was worried the color would be too loud.  The color is perfect! It is not loud at all; it is a very soft cotton candy pink.The laptop feels solid. It is also not a super heavy or bulky laptop, but also not as thin as an ultabook. It has a thin lid that keeps it somewhat light.I love the soft glow from the keyboard. I often like to sit at night with only a few candles burning and the TV and fireplace on, playing on my laptop and this feature fits perfectly into my life style.I also love the speedy start up feature. Never saw anything like it. You can shut the laptop totally down, lift the lid and in a few seconds you are ready to go.Windows 8 has some strange features; example a swipe with your mouse from the top of the screen to the bottom closes your program. I also spent more than a few minutes looking for the X to close programs and looking for the non existing start button.  But overall I like Windows 8.The laptop itself is very speedy. I watched a few HD movies on netflex and they ran perfectly with no lag. I also like to play online Facebook games etc., again the speed was lighting fast.I can't comment on the battery, because I almost never unplug my laptop so this feature is not important to me.The price is a very good value. I didn't want to spend over $500.00 since I normally replace my laptop every few years. I saw this pc listed for $60.00 bucks more and went the extra mile. I am so glad I did.I also love Amazon. I have been a member with Amazon since they started back in the 90's. I have never had any issues at all with Amazon. I also knew if I was not satisfied or happy, Amazon would, as they always do take care of me. So I was very confident placing my order.What I don't like about this laptop, nothing. I totally love it!Sony VAIO E15 Series SVE15124CXP 15.5-Inch Laptop (Pink)

Reviews.Title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE it!
Reviews.Author: L. Fann
Reviews.Content: I got this for a great price and I was able to take advantage of the 1 day shipping if using a Discover card. It arrived on time and I had it set up on no time. Wasn't sure if I would like Windows 8, but it works well for me and it didn't take long to get the hang of the new start menu tiles. The pink color is sure to deter my husband and son from getting on my computer...at least I hope so.

Reviews.Title: great!
Reviews.Author: steph
Reviews.Content: I got 2 day shipping it arrived on time and was worth the wait. the sound works awesome ! the mouse pad is amazing for fast zoom. color is great looks beautiful key pad is amazing I love it!! you will be happy with ur purchase!

Reviews.Title: Very Good Laptop!
Reviews.Author: Naulee
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for myself for school and college next year.The resolution is so amazing, and the speakers are crystal clearIt's so pretty, and its fast! I love the backlight keyboard for working in the dark.The rapid wake is so awesome, close the laptop lid and it goes to sleep, open it back up and it loads up everything in a matter of seconds!The 15.5 inch is perfect, it's not too big and its not too small (hence includes the numeric keypad).I'm also into gaming a bit, (not like super intense hardcore gaming where the fps has to be at least 30) but this laptop gets done with what I want it to.An added bonus is the Imagination Studio, I love editing videos together and my desktop has gotten so old (2004) and lost so much space, that it hasn't been able to get the job done, with Sony Vegas I can do all that.Now the cons:The webcam.... is god awful, they advertise HD but its max output is 1MP, so you're better off hooking up a different webcamThe touchpad is also really sensitive and hard to get used to, especially with Windows 8 and that new formatMy laptop came with part of the plastic backing loose and very fragile looking so I'm hoping a quick fix with super glue will help that EDIT: Nope it snapped back into place!So yeah, there aren't really many that issues with it all! I'm not really into Windows 8, but I figured I'd have to learn it eventually, and yeah, it's definitely going to take me a while. I already have a webcam to my desktop so I'm going to see how well that looks. Also I'm buying a mouse because in general, laptop touch pads and I just dont really agree, and just so you know USB mice work just fine if you don't want to splurge on a high priced wireless one. Also if you look on the internet and even Amazon says the battery life is 2.75 hours, don't worry, there are plenty of ways to adjust it, you're more likely to have 3-4 hours of straight web surfing, as for me I'm the type to keep my laptop plugged in for a majority of the time. Fingers crossed it lasts through the next 4 years of college!EDIT MARCH 6, 2013:So that little plastic piece I was talking about, yeah it broke. I glued it and taped it, oh well.Some small cosmetic scratches have also appeared, so I'm looking for a skin cover tooAlso about a month ago, my Windows did an update and had to restart when it got back to the login screen everything froze up, but not exactly, just that I couldn't get my keyboard to work (it wasn't connecting) but the system still was because the clock would change. I eventually had to use the assist function on it (which was working with the keyboard) and do a refresh, which uninstalled all my programs. So safe to say now I'm backing up all installation files.

Reviews.Title: VAIO is a great product
Reviews.Author: dzinn
Reviews.Content: We took delivery on a Friday three days after purchase. It a great laptop with lighted keys. After some quick personalization it is a very convient tool. We setup the tiles for all of our important apps to make using the laptop a one click function.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful laptop, but lots of problems.
Reviews.Author: Jessie
Reviews.Content: First of all, the light pink shade of this laptop is beautiful. It's not an obnoxious pink like many other pink shaded laptops, which is what first drew my interest. The programs that come with this laptop such as Vegas Movie Studio and Acid Music Studio are great as well.I have two problems with this laptop.1) The left/right click mouse buttons are terribly frustrating. It took me awhile to get used to them, and even now they still aggravate me.2) The casing on the side of the laptop seems to be rather poorly put together. Not even three months after buying this laptop brand new, the casing on the side starting coming off and it has gradually gotten worse.EDIT:-Half of the bottom part of my casing has now ripped off completely.-There is a constant white line running down the middle of my screen, indicating I need a new one.Perhaps my laptop was defected when I first got it, but I will never buy a Sony laptop ever again.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed. Windows 8 is useless also.
Reviews.Author: N. Markova
Reviews.Content: OK, so got this because I had a Samsung last which was an absolute lemon and crashed in every way within a year.First observation. Often I click on things and nothing happens. I have to click many times.It also crashes if you try and run too much.I am a photographer and enjoy doing preliminary editing in Windows 7 with the built in color corrector on Windows Photo Editor. It's not available on 8 so I will have to buy lightroom because photoshop is too complex to quickly whip through and crop.I also have had Vaio computers before and consider them a superior product. The Samsung I had was better than this one, out of the box - however I wouldn't get Samsung again as Best Buy didn't want to hear it when it broke.So it's decent, I'm not going to send it back because I need it on a daily basis, but my advice shop around. A laptop should be able to handle Chrome and Photoshop without slowing down. It's not horrible but it's not the $600 Macbook that some of the other reviewers talked about.On the plus side, I got the pink one and it is really fun.

Reviews.Title: Great computer!!!
Reviews.Author: Ursula Rogers
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful user-friendly computer, I love the soft pink color; Sony did an excellent job, a great computer to have.

Reviews.Title: love it!!
Reviews.Author: mary
Reviews.Content: wonderful laptop-love the lighted keypad-I like windows 8-but I also use classic shell--got the silver-but I wish I bought the pink-Great product!!

Reviews.Title: Bought for Grandson for Christmas/Graduation
Reviews.Author: sff
Reviews.Content: He loves it!  He said it has everything he wanted.  Windows 8 will take some getting used to but he will soon have it mastered.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: ME
Reviews.Content: I love the width of the screen, love the graphic and I like this new Windows 8, totally different and takes time to get use to it, but once I got the hang of it, I just love it!

Reviews.Title: looks great, works...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Ycela & Charles"
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful laptop. Pink is gorgeous!It was working fine, but after 6 months of owning this, it crashed! And that's because I didn't even have all my programs installed on it! I didn't want to fill up my computer with a lot of programs and software so I kept them at minimum... and STILL it crashed! Had to purchase a new hard drive! was so pissed!This is the second Sony laptop I'm not happy with!I may need to stop purchasing Sony and go with a different brand

Reviews.Title: Superior screen display and 5.5 hours battery life
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey A "Jeff"
Reviews.Content: This is no technical review ... just one to highlight the user-friendly features (and quirks) of this laptop.(I have been using this laptop since November 2012)PROS:This is definitely a superior laptop screen - the specs say 720p but the display is comparable to a 1080 HD.  Reading text is almost as crisp as the iPad's retina display.The lighted keyboard is so useful for working in a dimly lit room.  I use the laptop to follow the Bloomberg editors on twitter while looking at the channel on cable tv, sometimes in full darkness.Long life battery allows greater portability.  I was pleasantly surprised to get 5.5 hours of use on battery power at default brightness!This is twice what I had expected as the AMAZON'S PRODUCT DESCRIPTION WRONGLY STATES: 'Up to 2.75 hours of battery life at default brightness with standard 4000 mAh battery'.SEE MY PHOTOS IN CUSTOMER IMAGESThe Sony Vaio E15 laptop has one USB 3.0 port which is x 10 faster than the two standard USB 2.0 ports.The USB 3.0 port is handy for attaching an external drive so that data transfer can be done in a more timely manner.The DVD/CD optical drive's Cyberlink Power2Go software is very user friendly.Sony Vaio updates the computer hardware.  So far all updates have been seamless.A trial version of Microsoft Office 201O was installed on the Windows 8 OSI took advantage of paying for Office 201O  to automatically qualify for the free upgrade to Microsoft Office 2013(I downloaded and installed Microsoft Office 2013 on Friday 2nd February without any hiccups)With 750GB of Hard Disk storage and additional cloud storage on the Microsoft Skydrive, memory should not be an issue even if you're a data hog! :)CONS:Actually this a Microsoft issue rather than Sony's - Mastering Windows 8 is much too steep a learning curve over Windows 7.  So, be prepared to dedicate some time to re-learn this Windows 8 OSMY RECOMMENDATION:If you are pressed for time or, you don't want to 'figure' out how to use Windows 8, I recommend signing up for a crash course in course in 'Learning to Use the Windows 8 Operating System' :(With a 2.4 GHz Intel Core i3-3110M dual-core processor (3 MB cache) and 6 GB of installed DDR3 RAM, this Sony Vaio E15 laptop is adequate for running a small home office.Overall, this  Sony Vaio E15 laptop is a great little workhorse/entertainment device offered here on Amazon at a great price.Hope my review and photos weere helpful ... Jeffrey A. (Jeff)

Reviews.Title: pink lemon
Reviews.Author: anyte
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a christmas present for my 12 year old daughter.  She was very happy with it, using it for all her school work.  Then some Windows tiles started to not open and the next day the computer would not start.  Sony support walked me through an alternative way to start the computer and we did a reset back to the original configuration.  This meant I had to reload all the software and files we had added since we bought the computer.Two days later I had the same problem.  This time I told support I wouldn't waste my time on a reset and I demanded a replacement.  They arranged to have a technician come to my home and replace the hard drive.  Again I had to load the programs and files back onto the computer.  Some of the Windows tiles were still not opening but the computer worked for another week before it once again had the issue of not starting.  The last three weeks have been extremely frustrating.  I won't ever buy a Sony computer again.

Reviews.Title: Want my $600.00 back!
Reviews.Author: MarsArmy1977_Eric "Echelon01"
Reviews.Content: This laptop has been in repair for the majority of the time that I have owned it. I wish I would have returned it, pretty sure it's too late now. I love Sony, but I feel I must have bought a lemon with this model. So many problems with the OS!!!! Should not be shipped or built with Windows 8!!!! I am typing this review on my phone because at this moment my Sony Laptop is in repair AGAIN at Best Buy....this is my experience...

Reviews.Title: Mouse and operating system is frustrating
Reviews.Author: Timothy Budzinski
Reviews.Content: Mouse always locks up and the operating system is horrible to use.  The operating system is designed for a touch screen and sucks when using a mouse.  would spend the extra money and by a mac next time.

Reviews.Title: It never worked
Reviews.Author: Lore Huseby
Reviews.Content: I spent many hours on the phone with Sony to get it to work . In the end I sent it back actually with 3 days.

Reviews.Title: sony laptop
Reviews.Author: Deena Lincicome
Reviews.Content: This is my first sony laptop and I love it. I love that it has a backlit keyboard so I can see at night typing.

Reviews.Title: all was ok thanks, I was I requested, all was ok, thanks a lot for all, I will buying more
Reviews.Author: Norman
Reviews.Content: all was ok thanks, I was I requested, all was ok, thanks a lot for all, I will buying more

Reviews.Title: On my third hard drive, Sony's service has been great
Reviews.Author: josh justice
Reviews.Content: I have had to replace the hard drive twice since it was purchased. Sony's service department is awesome.  Instead of having to box the computer up and ship it back to them, they sent a service tech the next day to replace the hard drive and run the recovery.

Reviews.Title: Nice Laptop, Beware of any initial issues
Reviews.Author: J Chan "Juno"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice machine. Brought it for dad to use. He had a hard drive issue (or what I suspect to be a hard drive issue) after a few days of using the laptop. He was going to void the warranty and open the machine to get the drive replaced but I decided to look at it before he did that as a last resort. Turns out that the issue was common for VAIO machines with Win 8. I found a forum and someone gave troubleshooting steps to do some recovery measures and the problem was solved. If you experience any issues, I recommend that you check any tech forums for possible fixes before you decide to re-send the item to the shipper (if you do no reside in the US). Returning an item from Trinidad is a last resort as the returns process is a lot longer and expensive if you do not reside in the US.

Reviews.Title: The Best TV
Reviews.Author: love amazon
Reviews.Content: I really like this tv was so glad that I bought it. Everyone come to my house say how good the picture quality is. Love it 3-D movies it was here in about four days. Love shopping through Amazon

Reviews.Title: Good for a little while
Reviews.Author: T. Breslin
Reviews.Content: This computer worked fine until it just completely died on me, of course past the warrantee, at less than one year. The Geek Squad at Best Buy said it would cost $400 to fix- not worth it. Now I have to get a new one, which I am very unhappy about.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS COMPUTER!
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Its my baby! I don't much care about windows 8 because I end up using my desktop anyways! over all it came when expected and it doing great for a refurbished! Sometime buying refurbished is like buying it new! I don't like the mouse pad so I bought a mouse for this! Great computer and great buy!

Reviews.Title: Great price for a Sony
Reviews.Author: Christopher Whittle
Reviews.Content: I love the light up keys and the quality I would expect from Sony. I am still getting used to the mouse pad, since it is a bit touchy. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Cute Laptop.
Reviews.Author: Jill Koepke
Reviews.Content: I have been using this laptop for about a month and I have had mostly positive experiences with it. It is the largest laptop I have ever had so it seems a bit large for me but it is very convenient to have a complete number pad. The screen seems vibrant and of good quality. The computer doesn't have the fastest operating system, so, at times, it seems to take a long time to load things. I have also had some issues with certain apps frequently crashing. I do not know if this is a problem with the computer itself, or the app. It's a very pretty laptop and the lighted keys are very convenient at night. I would recommend it to a friend using the computer for general computing or school. Not for a gamer and it's so-so at video streaming in my experience.

Reviews.Title: Just buy it you cant go wrong
Reviews.Author: Tedmund Smith
Reviews.Content: There isnt any thing i can say bad about this computer and not enough space to tell you all the good things about it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect experience
Reviews.Author: AilenDCF
Reviews.Content: I love this product! The experience was perfect, the product arrived quicker than planned. I'm 100 % conformable.I recommend this product to everyone, is amazing!

Reviews.Title: Super!
Reviews.Author: Antonio Figueredo
Reviews.Content: This laptop is very fast and the Windows 8 just take less of 1 minute to startup! The system is very stable and the backlit is the best! I recomment this laptop! Good purchase..!

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: Grrrrrr "C.K."
Reviews.Content: learning to love my new laptop. Wanted to buy another one for my daughter from amazon but no more in stock. ended up paying an extra $100 for one from someone else and praying that she gets it.windows 8 is a pain in the toosh but I am getting used to it. youtube tutorials help. lolits a good computer and good value for what you get.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Ken Anderson
Reviews.Content: I received the computer quickly and everything was in good working order. I have no experience with Windows 8 so Im getting used to the operation and all the features now. Its an amazing computer, great graphics and sound, and I would definitely purchase again

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop
Reviews.Author: Mom to 4 Boyz "Got4Boyz"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use.  Love the lighted keyboard.  Can sit in the living room with the family and the lights low and see what I am doing.  Windows 8 is proving challenging for me- but that is a Windows issue not a laptop issue.  Love the color- the boys won't use my laptop now ;-)  Startup and shutdown is fast.  So far very happy with this computer.

Reviews.Title: hard to learn
Reviews.Author: Kelly Little
Reviews.Content: I can't get my kids Club penguin to work since Adobe flash player is included in windows 8 but won't work and if you get a window 8 take a class to learn how to use it.  The computer is great, its the windows 8 I have problems with and wish I had chosen windows 7

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: So far I love my new laptop, however I have to get use to Windows 8! I am use to Windows 7 and it didn't come with any booklet or info on how to use it! I work on computers all day long but new stuff I guess being over 40 years old I am just use to the old Windows! But for the price its a great value.  Also works fast and the screen is pretty big.

Reviews.Title: Solid Computer
Reviews.Author: Chad Molten
Reviews.Content: So far this computer has performed exemplary. It is quick and smooth with windows 8 new interface and Flys on the Internet.

Reviews.Title: Sony VAIO E15 Series review
Reviews.Author: Collinsworth Howard
Reviews.Content: This product met my every expectation, the tone of pink is soft on the eyes and its overall performance makes you want to use the product more .....Thank you Sony.. Thank you Amazon for a timely delivery.....

Reviews.Title: Easy on the Eyes
Reviews.Author: mattH
Reviews.Content: This laptop definitely comes out looking as beautiful as any laptop could. Its backlit keyboard does not display awkwardly during the day and at night looks perfect for use but does not blind the user. The screen has a crystal clear image. Playing an MMO on it is comparable to what I have seen on higher end laptops that cost in the thousands. The keyboard layout is ideal with shortcut buttons that make sense. This laptop is definitely user friendly. Sony support is excellent. When I ran into an issue with the computer I was able to contact support and they solved the issue within moments. The person I spoke to had no issues understanding me and was quick to provide a clear solution. There is a button on this laptop called the "ASSIST" button. I have yet to find all of its usefulness but I do know that it can help with most issues encountered on the computer. The VAIO installed products on this computer are not as intrusive as it is with most other laptops. There are not constant pop ups about the programs and their "neat" features that I encountered with other laptops. If you want to use the VAIO programs you can. If not they will not bug you. I do warn Windows 8 is one of the most awkward OS that I have ever seen. It was obviously designed without desktop and laptop use in mind. Since it is designed for a tablet it almost requires a touch screen for convenient use. This laptop does not have one so navigating Windows 8 may be a problem. Once you get used to it Windows 8 can quickly be bypassed for computer use similar to Windows 7. My suggestion is to watch YouTube videos that will explain how to navigate the OS. The speed of the computer is excellent. I played an MMO with no lag through a complex dungeon that almost always lags and glitches my computer. There were no such events. Sometimes when working with Windows 8 it is slow to respond as there is a whole tab system that bogs down the computer. The installation of programs is quick and easy. Also, for anyone who does not want to purchase Microsoft Office products due to their inflated price, there is no longer a Microsoft works already installed on the computer as was with most previous Microsoft OS products. I suggest downloading Open Office which is free but not as efficient as either Office or Works. Overall, this computer is excellent as it provides a user friendly experience. The specifications of the computer are very nice for the price. The features are also very dependable. I highly suggest purchasing this product.PROS:Good selling price for high end computer.Excellent user friendly features such as backlit keyboard and Hi-Def screen.Great speed for most home use programs.Superb customer support.Sleek look and feel.CONS:Windows 8 disappoints.Poor speakers for audio, use headphones or external speakers (not very expensive)

Reviews.Title: Picked it for the color & design
Reviews.Author: CnCnMJ
Reviews.Content: The most useful feature is really the backlit keyboard. I'm just curious why it doesn't have an LED indicator for wireless and wired connections like most laptops including my older Sony VAIO.

Reviews.Title: Awful service on broken screen
Reviews.Author: S. Malone
Reviews.Content: The latch to the screen broke after about two months and Sony made it so difficult to get it fixed. I spent weeks (not hours) trying to get it fixed under warranty. Sony did everything they could to avoid fixing the laptop.I understand that products break but good after service is important. I will never buy a Sony product again after all of the headache and work that I had to do to get this product fixed

Reviews.Title: No more SONY for me.
Reviews.Author: J. Galt "Forcas"
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Vaio (specific model number no longer sold) a few months ago. My review is both about Vaio product quality in general, and the Sony customer service/repair process. I am posting it on Vaio products to alert other consumers what customer service level they can expect when they buy a Vaio. The screen on my unit had the backlight fail after a few months of use. I have had Sony repair it three times. Each time they returned it, it still had the same problem. After the third time, I gave up on Sony and purchased a comparable ASUS notebook, which has worked perfectly. The reason why I have given 1/5 stars is because Sony was inefficient, rude, and downright dishonest about their "repair" process. Only once out of three times did they get the shipping box, repair process, or return process done in the turnaround time they promised. At no point did they actually repair the laptop! After receiving the still defective laptop back for the third time, I called their service center in Laredo Texas and asked what they had done to repair it. They told me that the internal cable for the screen had never been properly connected, and they plugged it in. I asked if that meant it was repaired, and was told by the representative that they were unable to commit that the laptop had been repaired or would be functional. Out of the 2 months I spent dealing with Sony, this was one of the few honest statements they made: My laptop is still as useless as the day I first called their tech support. I will never purchase another Sony product as a result of this experience, and to anyone that buys a Vaio: Hope that it works perfectly. Otherwise, Sony will take it from you for 12-20 days (not the 10 they promise) and then return it to you still broken -- 3 times in a row.

Reviews.Title: Sonny Laptop windows 8
Reviews.Author: Charles S. Graham
Reviews.Content: I believe this is a great product.  Unfortunately, I ordered this item unintentionally and had to return it.  I would, however, recommend this product.  That is why I gave it a 5 Star rating.

Reviews.Title: Laptop
Reviews.Author: Sandra Neises
Reviews.Content: I like the fact there is a number pad on the side. The keys light up to make seeing your keyboard easy. The mouse pad area is very sensitive and will skip your typing around quite often. You have to be sure that you are sitting up and using proper posture in order to keep from accidently skipping around.

Reviews.Title: The absolute worst product I have ever purchased on Amazon
Reviews.Author: darrell cook
Reviews.Content: This unit has been nothing but a problem since day one. Windows 8 is difficult to navigate but the sensitivity of the mouse makes it next to impossible.  The user guide is buried deep inside the software and relatively useless when the unit won't operate properly.  I purchased this for my business so that I would be able to have speed and ease when placing items on my website. When there has been a connectivity problem, it forced me to disconnect the entire house.  I can still use my desktop and other laptops just fine but the Vaio somehow gets disconnected.  I wish I had returned it but i felt I would get used to windows 8 and things would be fine.I am sad to say that I am writing this on my Windows Vista desktop because once again, the Vaio has shut itself off.  It says it may take over an hour to fix disk problems I didn't even know existed. If I could give it no stars, I would.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this product!!!
Reviews.Author: Carolyn Seidler
Reviews.Content: The Sony VAIO quit 2 days after I received it and Sony would do nothing to replace the computer.  Thank goodness Amazon refunded my money in full.  I would not recommend this computer to anyone, in fact, I would discourage anyone from buying a Sony VAIO and any other Sony product for that matter.  I try to only purchase from companies that stand behind their products and clearly Sony does not.

Reviews.Title: Feh! Windows 8.
Reviews.Author: A. Carr "game hater"
Reviews.Content: The problem with this laptop is Windows 8.  The ads portray it as simple and intuitive.  It is anything but.  I bought this to replace my wife's aging HP laptop, but she hates it and tells me every day how frustrating it is to navigate Windows 8.  The computer itself works very well but it is handicapped beyond redemption by Windows 8.

Reviews.Title: Disgraceful
Reviews.Author: Blane33
Reviews.Content: Absolutely horrible and un-reliable device.  Laptop looks nice, but the hardware is constantly failing, restarting and crashing.  I'm certain that windows 8 is not much help either, as it appears geared towards a touchscreen, not a simple point and click laptop.  sony should be ashamed to put their name on such shoddy hardware.on almost a daily basis, we experience:Non-loading of windowskeyboard failure requiring restartmouse failure, or inability to right-clickblank screen with cursor only

Reviews.Title: Does not connect to Internet, no matter what settings are used
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Shames
Reviews.Content: This computer will not connect to the Internet, no matter what settings we use.  It is not possible to use this computer for its intended purpose.

Reviews.Title: Window 8
Reviews.Author: Janice Criswell
Reviews.Content: Windows 8 is the worst...Can't find anything on it.  It is the worst.  Everyone stick with the windows 7.  much simplier. Would not recommend this computer to anyone.

Reviews.Title: there was a noise that i hated
Reviews.Author: beglisefa
Reviews.Content: I didnt like it. there fore I had to return it back. Respond was very late. Late means late .

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel Core i3-3110M 2.5 GHz
6 GB DDR3
750 GB 5400 rpm Hard Drive
15.5-Inch Screen
Windows 8
ProductInfo.Name: Sony VAIO E15 Series SVE15124CXW 15.5-Inch Laptop (White)
